channel.title: HP Vista Laptop
channel.description:
It's been running fine since I got it in the summer, but now it's really slow. Any tips on how I can make it perform faster. My mom, who's a complete retard with computers, says I should delete lots of the unnecessary programs, i.e. trial programs and other random programs. But before I do something I regret, I wanted to consult the expertise of the people on this forum board.
Any suggestions??

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @nicatron nicatron
item.description:
@nicatron wrote:

yes, and if you can’t, get XP pro.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @lordslayer565 lordslayer565
item.description:
@lordslayer565 wrote:

Yup, some RAM should easily fix it. Vista was hell when I had only 512MB. You can buy 2 1GB RAM modules on Newegg.com for around $40.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

bigh51:

remove unneeded programs, do disk cleanup, do a disk defragmentation, clear temporary internet files, add more virtual memory and then your good.

I’d say he needs more physical memory.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“MybJames, post:7, topic:168093”][quote author=ThugLife link=topic=227594.msg1955903#msg1955903 date=1198762421]

Heres an idea, get rid of vista.

Heres an idea, Shut the fuck up for once.
[/quote]
QFT

To the topic creator: I can’t see why you would call your mum a retard with computers, when you don’t even know how much RAM you have. Or even how to look it up.[/quote]exactly.

remove unneeded programs, do disk cleanup, do a disk defragmentation, clear temporary internet files, add more virtual memory and then your good.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

Um get ccleaner and make it clean the unnecessarily files that maybe have viruses…

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Flaming Idiot:

You may be able to cheaply increase your RAM

It’s not real ram though, it’s using disk space as RAM so it is slower.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Flaming_Idiot Flaming Idiot
item.description:
@Flaming_Idiot wrote:

You may be able to cheaply increase your RAM by using ReadyBoost, a feature in Vista where you use USB memory sticks as RAM.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

You either need to buy more, better RAM. Or, install XP. It’s really that simple.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

Well I know I don;t have a virus or anything like it because I have not downloaded files or anything else from the Internet. Viruses from things like pornographic sites are out of the question too, seeing that I have a girlfriend to do that stuff with :D.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Chimaera God, post:17, topic:168093”]Thanks

Here are the pics:

By the way Legit, the attached pic says you have 2048 MB, how do you get it that high?[/quote]

Your clock speed is decent (I’m going by Taylor core, not the reported core speed because of AMD’s Cool ‘n’ Quiet).

Yea, it’s mostly the RAM that should be causing problems. @Thuglife… his RAM has 300 MHz single channel clock speed. It’s not just about size.

A virus scan couldn’t hurt either.

I got my RAM to 2 GB by buying it lol. Two sticks of low latency 1 GB RAM goes for $35 if you know where to look.

[quote=“mrrules, post:18, topic:168093”]Install XP. DONE

But really HP and vista together was a bad choice anyway.

You should get a cracked XP off internet… My friend been running off his for awile and has no trouble.[/quote]

Uhh… what’s wrong with HP and Vista?

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

In the reply form, not the quick-reply box, there should be a button that says “Additional Options…”
Click that, and there will be an “Attach:” field. If you wish to attach more (up to 5 per post), click the “(more attachments)” link.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

How do I attach the pics to my post. I only know how to post pics, not attach them.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Vista will run just fine on a 512mb computer, since thats what came with my computer and i firstly installed windows xp since hearing all the bad comments about vista, but a few days later installed vista on it and it ran just as fast as xp did, i still have not found any bugs in vista after running it for a whole year.

Since then though i have upgraded my ram several times for certain games and to basically get more out of my computer.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

What do you know? I was right.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Chimaera, download my attachment (no viruses, I promise), un-zip and run cpu-z.exe.

Hit F5 to take a screenshot of the current tab (CPU), then click the Memory tab and hit F5 again. In the folder with cpu-z.exe, there should be two images named cpu-xxxx.bmp and memory-xxxx.bmp. Attach those and post it. Here’s attachment and examples:

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

That’s pretty bad, the minimum RAM for Vista is really 1 GB. 2 GB is what’s recommended. You have 512MB, which is really too low for Vista. I’d recommend downgrading to XP or choosing some sort of Linux distro.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:

item.title: HP Vista Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

Schizzo:

Apparently, your mom knows more than you because she’s right. I’m going to guess that you have a lot of programs running that you don’t need. You should visit www.tweakvista.com for tips on how to enhance your performance. Just out of curiosity though, how much RAM do you have?

no clue

Read full topic
